boardgame.name: Cantilupe
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Spring, 1375
Just after the Feast of the Annunciation
Sir William de Cantilupe’s corpse has been found by the side of a road near Grayingham. It was arranged to appear as if he had been attacked by bandits, but the deception was poorly done. De Cantilupe was murdered in a more intimate fashion.
In the de Cantilupe manor house in Scotton, Lincolnshire, those who knew him best assemble to remember Sir William and lament his foul murder.

That’s the story, anyway.

In truth Sir William de Cantilupe was a complete bastard and everyone from wife to scullery maid wanted him dead. Almost everybody here took their shot, with knife or poison or bare hands. The only question now is who is going to take the blame.

The answer to that is simple—the one who didn’t even try. For someone in this room isn’t guilty, and that person is the one who must hang for the crime. Conspiracy, it seems, is a profound social leveler.

Cantilupe is a live-action roleplaying game.

Logistics:
Participants: 4-8
Time: 1 hour of play
Tone: Darkly comic
Content warnings: Murder, inter-player competition

boardgame.name: Kill or Cure (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The MacGregor Clinic is deeply sick.

Patients vanish into shady drug trials.

Scalpel-fingered monsters haunt nurses’ dreams.

A nightmare realm hides behind the clinic’s mirrors.

Diagnose the clinic and purge its sickness in Kill or Cure.

Kill or Cure is about the ways the healthcare system fails those who most need it – and the importance of fighting back. Expose the clinic’s crimes, bring down the doctors profiting off of other’s misery, and delve into the clinic’s shadow to purge the evil lurking there.

Please note: Kill or Cure is a scenario about the ways the medical establishment punishes, marginalises and ignores those on the fringes of society. To that end, it carries a content warning for: medical procedures (injections, surgery, IV drips, etc), medical malpractice, ableism, violation of bodily autonomy, gatekeeping, abuse of power, institutional bigotry and invasion of privacy.

In Kill or Cure, you can…

Play one of five pre-generated characters: a patient, an occultist, an athlete and more.
Lay a ghost to rest, reaffirm your love for your spouse, make friends with a barista.
Channel the Void’s power in the real world, and gain supernatural powers in the otherworldly clinic feeding off this place’s misery.
Fight the avatar of Gatekeeping and strange it with its own chain.


All with the dynamic rules of Voidheart Symphony, custom-tuned for one-shot games; three options for dark mysteries lurking in the heart of the clinic; and full details on the Perfected Clinic, the shadow realm that feeds on the clinic’s sickness.

Get this book, get some friends, and get ready to cure your city!

boardgame.name: Camp Hope
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:



A Summer Camp Micro-setting For Stranger Stuff

Featuring An Adaptation Of Summer C.A.M.P. & A Bonus Cryptozoological & Encounter Guide Of Creatures!

Welcome to the crystal-clear Lake Granger, and the newly reopened Camp Hope!

Camp Hope is a recently reopened summer camp on picturesque Lake Granger. The camp spent many years closed and abandoned after several grisly murders were committed there in the late 1960s by a deranged camp counselor — at least, that’s what was in the papers; it was a long time ago, after all. This horrific incident, as well as several unavoidable lawsuits, bankrupted the owner.

This book includes a detailed description of a summer camp for the Kids to explore and even work at, as well as all-new rules for setting up a camp and earning merit badges (with in-game effects). Also included in this book are over a dozen adventure hooks, ideas for threats, and challenges for a Gamemaster to flesh out themselves fully to have their Kids take on. These hooks are more than “the usual problems of trying to become Camp Champ; Gamemasters will find stranger ideas included here like protoplasmic alien horrors lurking in the woods, ghostly pirates and their treasure, witchy camp counselors starting covens in their cabins, and much more!

This book also includes a complete Stranger Stuff for TinyD6 version of the original vs. Stranger Stuff Adventure: Summer C.A.M.P., where the Kids get a chance to earn a bit of cash and even help convert the old Camp Granger into the new, modern Camp Hope!

boardgame.name: Sympathy for the Devil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Sympathy for the Devil, a group of level-3 adventurers meets Daniel Sands, the sacred healer. The former priest worked as a doctor in the region and one day was visited by Yal, a devil. Clever Yal promised Daniel real power and magic to cure and heal people. The human accepted for his only goal was to help others.

This adventure shall test minds and hearts. The healer and Yal become one, and they are surrounded by dozens of followers that have formed a cult. They were all crippled and withered old people waiting for death; Daniel gave them back their health and a purpose in life. But their health comes with a price; a subconscious loyalty to the devil. Daniel's entourage will do everything for him. Plus, killing the healer would undo every cure and return the townsfolk to their former state of health.

boardgame.name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Conqueror Worm Expansion
boardgame.description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – Conqueror Worm adds gameplay elements from the "Conqueror Worm" storyline in the Hellboy comic series to Hellboy: The Board Game.

The Conqueror Worm was part of the original Hellboy: The Board Game Kickstarter but has never been released as a separate expansion before. This is the first time it's been made available in a standalone box, with its own packaging.

This expansion consists of:

2 hero miniature (Lobster Johnson & Roger)
2 agent card
4 Starting cards
1 boss (The Conqueror Worm)
2 case file decks
15 Nazi enemies (3 of each Riflemen, Officers, Machine Gunners, Specialists & Knife Fighters)
10 encounter cards
9 requisition / starting cards
4 double sided game tiles
2 scenery tokens
Rules card: New Scenery
additional enemy cards
additional deck of doom cards
additional boss behaviour cards
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Hellboy: The Board Game – Deluxe Edition

boardgame.name: CubeClimbers
boardgame.description:
CubeClimbers is a strategy game for 2-4 players where you compete for the highest spot of a mountain by stacking MagnetCubes, pushing opponents, using grappling hooks, and unleashing superpowers. With precision, ingenious tactics, and a dash of luck, you might just claim the top!

CubeClimbers features MagnetCubes which are elegant building blocks that magnetically snap together. Building with them results in a dynamic playing field with unique 3D board states every turn. Players start on a base of prearranged cubes. Each player is then dealt an even and equal number of the remaining cubes. Players are also dealt 2 of 16 unique asymmetric player powers that can each be used once a game.

During their turn, players BUILD 2 cubes, MOVE to an adjacent space, and ROLL. Rolling gives players a chance to reposition with the grappling hook or push all players in a direction of their choice with wind. Players must perform all three actions once in any order to end their turn and may also use their powers as optional actions. The game keeps going until the player who builds the last remaining cube ends their turn.

The player at the highest level of the mountain when the game ends wins!

boardgame.name: Retired Men's Nude Beach Volleyball
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Beach wolley game by Will Brierly (in collaboration with Rachel Olson and Aaron Bleyaert) where you play as a retired man in a nude beach volley tournament.

boardgame.name: Hunter's Arena: Legends
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Set in ancient Asia - with a touch of fantasy and myths, where there the peace is shattered by demons set free and hunters must go hunt the demons - and the hunter who released them!

boardgame.name: Global Holdings
boardgame.description:
Global Holdings is a Monopoly clone.

It includes all of the elements of classic Monopoly but the setting is the entire world. The properties cost more and you'll build apartments instead of houses before moving on to hotels.

The winner is the one to amass the most property thus driving their opponents into bankruptcy.

boardgame.name: Yeti Trek
boardgame.description:
Yeti Trek is a quick, medium-weight game for 2 players. Race across a vast mountain range and be the first yeti to reach the summit to win!

The flow of Yeti Trek is as follows:
1. One player rolls all 6 dice and splits the dice into 2 groups
2. The other player choose which group of dice they want. The remaining group goes to the first player.
3. Use your dice to move your Yeti meeple across the mountain range. To move on the mountain range, the space that you end your movement on must match the color of the dice that you discarded. In addition, the total value of the dice discarded must be equal to or greater than the total on all the spaces that you moved through this turn.

Optionally utilize a rondel every turn before you move to gain bonuses to your movement.

Once both players have used all of their dice, the round is over and a new round starts. The game ends immediately once one players reaches one of the Summit spaces.

boardgame.name: Handler's Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Handler's Screen for Delta Green: The Role-Playing Game provides the Handler (game moderator) tons of useful tools for running the game. This downloadable version includes:

Full-size exterior with chilling art by Dennis Detwiller (8.5" high by 44" wide)
Full-size interior with four panels of tables and information (8.5" high by 44" wide)
Panel 1 exterior (8.5" high by 11" wide)
Panel 1 interior — Using Stats & Skills
Panel 1 interior, printer friendly
Panel 2 exterior (8.5" high by 11" wide)
Panel 2 interior — Combat
Panel 2 interior, printer friendly
Panel 3 exterior (8.5" high by 11" wide)
Panel 3 interior — Wounds & Ailments
Panel 3 interior, printer friendly
Panel 4 exterior (8.5" high by 11" wide)
Panel 4 interior — Sanity & Willpower
Panel 4 interior, printer friendly
Combine the Handler's Screen with Delta Green: Need to Know and Delta Green: Agent's Handbook to launch new Delta Green campaigns. Delta Green: The Role-Playing Game is fully compatible with all past Delta Green products.

boardgame.name: Floor Plan: The Winchester Mystery House
boardgame.description:
10,000 windows, 2,000 doors, and 40 staircases. Truly, the Winchester Mystery House is a marvel of Victorian architecture, and now you too can contribute to Sarah’s evolving Floor Plan!

It is said that Sarah Winchester perpetually added to the house to confuse the ghosts, and now 100 years later, you can continue her legacy. In Floor Plan Winchester Mystery House, you will be challenged to build on 2 different stories and fulfill 6 different building requirements per game in this Roll-N-Write for 1-6 players!

Floor Plan: The Winchester Mystery House is based on the hit game Floor Plan from Deep Water Games and is an officially licensed product.

Gameplay description:
Once per turn, players roll two dice in the center of the table and all players use the roll to either draw a new room into their house or draw features in rooms they’ve already drawn.

Every game of Floor Plan: The Winchester Mystery House uses 3 of the 15 scoring cards - all based on real design and architectural elements of the house.

If your design matches a scoring goal, you add the listed points on your sheet. The game ends when a player has completed 5 goals, then the player with the most points wins. Earn extra points at the end of the game from Spirit bonuses and the upper and lower floor layout goals.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pocket Master Builder
boardgame.description:
As kingdom architects, players will need to collect raw materials to construct various buildings, build walls to resist the invasion of northern barbarians, and use the king's reward properly to speed up your progress. Try to be the player with the most honors (VP) at the game's end.

Players play a card to the kingdom area, place workers on the edge of the card to collect resources, and then may use resources to construct a building.

The game end is triggered when a player has built 6 buildings. Each player totals their honors (VP) from their Buildings, Walls, Donkey and Oracle Cards.

boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
Issue 56
July 2021

50 best party games ever

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming - The Best Games of 2020
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming

The Best Games of 2020

boardgame.name: Flatten the Curve
boardgame.description:
Flatten The Curve is an entertaining board game for kids and adults alike, bringing virus safety-awareness through play.
A horrible illness is attacking your city! Will you forget your mask and get infected? Be smart, stay sharp, and move fast to get you and your family out of the pandemic - safe and healthy.

Players roll dice and move their families around a Monopoly-like board. Event cards add twists to the game. But be careful, some space can cause you to get sick and have to go into quarantine!

The first person to move all 5 of their family around the board, wins.

boardgame.name: Rune (Issue 37 - 2013)
boardgame.description:
Rune
2013
Number 37

Lorien Trust

boardgame.name: Lorien Trust Rules Handbook (Version 4)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Lorien Trust and the Lorien Trust Player’s Handbook and Game Rules 4.05. It covers everything from a basic knowledge of the history of the game world of Erdreja, to the various people and races, with descriptions of the skills and rules needed to role-play within the game.
...
Lorien Trust events are some of the largest in the United Kingdom and are filled with Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Fey, Half-Kin and a whole range of Strange Creatures. Coupled with 25+ Years of actual role-played history and thousands more written in Lore and Background, the Lorien Trust offer a chance for you to adventure in a world of conflict, trade, performance, politics, myth and magic. Choose your character and skills, face hordes of enemies, trade and craft, perform and make friends from different Nations, Races and Guilds ... Be the legend of your imagination.

boardgame.name: Infinite Chaos
boardgame.description:
Infinite Chaos is an out-of-this-world card game where you work with friends and family to create the craziest way to solve a problem or create one.

Players start by designating a Chaosmaster (Judge) to create an objective involving a chaos card ranging from serious issues like world hunger to more light-hearted ones such as family reunions. Everyone else draws questionable idea cards, random components to aid you in formulating your soon-to-be master plan, which they will use to compete against others to meet the Chaosmaster's objective. The Chaosmaster will then award the chaos card to whoever's plan was the best. A new Chaosmaster is then selected, and a winner is decided by whoever has the most chaos cards when the game ends.

boardgame.name: Pepinillo
boardgame.description:
A party game where players create a chain of syllables that continues without stopping. If the players go wrong, they will be penalized.

In the game, there are 3 cards on the table that have different hand gestures (in total there are 15 cards with different gestures but we only use 3 in each game). Also on the table is another card with different words from different categories (food, objects, countries).

Players in each round choose a word and each player has to say one syllable of the word. When you say a syllable, you can also make a gesture of the 3 that are on the table (the next player repeats a syllable, has to say a syllable with another vowel, change the direction of the game, etc.)

When a player makes a mistake in saying his syllable, the round ends and takes one of the 12 unused gesture cards. Each card has 1-3 pickles. The player with the fewest pickles at the end of the game will be the winner.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Jack Frost
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

IT’S THE MOST WONDERFUL TIME OF THE YEAR
A rural Alabama valley has always been prone to severe cold snaps. On 22 DEC 1998, the worst “Jack Frost” storm in history hit the farming town of Willis. A lingering freeze and sudden flood killed dozens.
   Your players get a ground view of that apocalyptic storm. Their scientists, drawn from an ultra-classified UFO research project, suspect that something otherworldly is at work. Their investigation may reveal a threat more vast and terrifying than they could conceive.
 Jack Frost is a scenario for Delta Green: The Role-Playing Game. It features the other side of one of Delta Green’s deadliest conflicts: the researchers and soldiers of the legendary MAJESTIC program.


PROJECT PLUTO: Experts from the top-secret labs at Area 51.
OPERATION BLUE FLY: Pararescuemen and pilots trained to recover alien technology.
NRO DELTA: The lethal “men in black” who keep America’s secrets from America itself.


   So bundle up. Mull your cider and wine. Put a few more logs on the fire and pull your family close. Pretend you can’t hear the sounds outside. Tell yourself they’re only the wind. They have to be just the wind.
   Looks like Jack Frost is coming to town again.

boardgame.name: Keys to the Ice Castle
boardgame.description:
Keys to the Ice Castle is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Based on the Keys to the Castle game players choose a knight token and then race through a tile based maze to get to the other side.

By opening and locking doors (the tiles) each player can help him or herself while hindering their opponents. Use the special cards such as the axe, magic wand, slide, or freeze to add even more to the gameplay.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Diplomaten-Spiel
boardgame.description:
For each number of players, there are starting positions given. The goal of the game is to block enemy pieces by jumping on top of them.

Movement is to any empty neighboring space which is connected to the starting space by a line. An enemy piece may be captured by jumping over it to an empty space behind it. The captured space is stacked under the attacking piece or stack. The piece on top moves the entire stack. When a stack is jumped over, only the piece on top is captured. Capturing may be perormed in a series of jumps.

To win the game one has to immobilize all enemy pieces by being on top all other pieces.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Champion Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 5 cards that were provided as participation reward in the last European, North American and World Championships.

These 5 cards were designed by previous Continental/World championship winners as part of their prize, but were never included in the Force Packs before the end of the game was announced.

Each of these cards can be used to replace a card with the same set-number in any objective set.

Cards in this set are:
Aurra Sing — 2016 North American Champ Josh Johnson
Darth Vader — 2016 World Champion Brad Emon
It’s Beautiful — 2017 World Champion Mick Cipra
K-2SO — 2017 European Champion Pawel Zochowski
Profundity — 2017 North American Champion James Lau

These cards are also available in a Print to Play file through the FFG site.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

boardgame.name: War For Chicken Island: Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goals
boardgame.description:

- Additional Scroll cards
- Wooden pilot meeples
- Cloth draw bag

boardgame.name: Risk: Deep Space
boardgame.description:
CONQUER THE UNIVERSE: Why conquer the globe when you can conquer the universe instead? The Risk Deep Space strategy game is an exciting fast-paced, spaced-based twist on the classic Risk board game.

Risk: Deep Space has 9 planets where players try to be the first to control 4 planets. Players battle for planets and attack intergalactic adversaries with a roll of the dice. Players need recruits and resources as they strive to build bases on as many planets as possible. Each time a player lands on a planet, they must immediately have a dice battle until only one player is left.

Includes gameboard, 128 plastic recruits, 20 plastic bases, 36 action cards, 2 dice, 30 gem tokens, 30 ore tokens, 2 planet covers, and instruction booklet.

boardgame.name: Dagger: RPG Toolkit for Gaming With Kids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dagger is a simple toolkit for fantasy gaming with kids. It is all about making gaming with young children quick and easy for you while fun and exciting for them.

The bottom line is Dagger is all about everyone having fun gaming together.

All you need to play Dagger [are] 6-sided dice, paper, pencils, and a whole bunch of imagination. An adult or older sibling runs the game as the Game Master and the kids play as the Heroes.

boardgame.name: Alphabet Runner Games
boardgame.description:
The game is created by the winner of The Best Family Game Award - UK Games Expo 2007.
The game has received 3 Awards. Free Play Online Game is on the Alphabet Runner website - Feb 2022.
Accreditation Certificate received from The Good Play Guide review and the Seal of Approval Award from Imagination Gaming.

Alphabet Runner Games is 3 games in 1 set of cards.

Maxxras. Word game which contains 10 levels. Age 11 - 99
Pairs. A memory recall game. Age 10+
Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game. Age 9+


Maxxras: Players begin at level 1 and build/create/form 3 or 4 letter words and progress to level 10 and build/create/form 15 or more letter words. Maxxras is simple to begin and then through the levels becomes one of the most challenging word games in the world. There is lots of room for progression as it gets harder each time more letters are needed to make a word. Maxxras is probably the only word game in the world that allows the players the opportunity of building/creating/forming a 45 letter word – “pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanokoniosis” whilst playing Level 10. Maxxras is for the word game fans in the family and for the players that like being challenged. It’s an ideal travel game.

Deal 7 random cards to each player. Place 3 or 4 cards face-up randomly and then place level 1 card next to the cards in the centre play area.
Level 1 is to create 3 or 4 letter words. Take turns to build a word by using at least 1 alphabet letter from 1 of your own cards and using letters from the other cards in the centre play area. Once a player has created a word, place the card separately from the other cards in the centre play area and then reveal/confirm the word to the other players to avoid picking up an additional card from the deck. Then place that card on top of any card in the centre play area.

The first player to get rid of their cards outright wins that level. The player that wins the most number of levels is the Maxxras winner.
Full details and videos on how to start and how to end the Maxxras word game are available on the Maxxras YouTube Channel.

Game 2
Pairs. A memory recall game.

Game 3
Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game.

boardgame.name: They Feed On Fear
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

THEY FEED ON FEAR is a semi-cooperative, horror-themed, narrative tabletop roleplaying game (RPG). The players embody Fear-Eaters; eldritch interdimensional beings that feed on a form of human energy called Essence. A Fear-Eater’s aim is to be the first to accumulate sufficient Essence to achieve its End Goal. One person assumes the role of the Provider (game master) and is in charge of describing the game’s world, its inhabitants and their responses to player actions.

Unlike most RPGs, the Provider does not issue quests. Instead, players are the primary action initiators, determining their own path toward realizing their End Goal. Both players and the Provider participate in creating and introducing locations to a Community. THEY FEED ON FEAR is about creating each Fear-Eater’s narrative, legend and Lore.

WARNING: BEFORE PROCEEDING

THEY FEED ON FEAR is a supernatural horror game that explores horror tropes. During the game, players will likely encounter themes of abduction, trauma and death.

Players are taking on the role of a monster, who disregards, and feeds on, human life. These monsters harm, murder, and victimize animals and people of all sorts, possibly including children. All players must discuss what topics are included and not included during a session. It is important that players respect this social contract. There are many, varied RPG safety tools available, pick one that works best for the group, and use it.

DISCLAIMER: Player’s discretion is advised.

Shrapnel

boardgame.name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep
boardgame.description:
The second cycle of the "Monsters" series features underwater sea monsters from classical and modern mythology, ranging from Nessie and Captain Nemo up to the Leviathan (Midgard Serpent) and The Old One. All monsters and tactical cards (neutralizers) have unique powers from the other cycles.

Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Then, tactical cards (neutralizers) destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck. At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

At the end the game have the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards to win.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: Attack of the Baby Koalas
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them

boardgame.name: Hero System Book of Templates II
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

W're making it easy for you again

Characters. Who has the time to make them? In this book you will find 22 characters ready for you to use in your Champions Campaign right now with no preparation - and no waiting! Every template comes with a detailed explanation of its strength, weaknesses, combat uses, and non-combat uses for the best possible play experience. The Hero System Nook of Templates is a perfect resource for new players and game masters who need generic comic book character ideas explained in Hero System 6th Edition terms; or for experienced ones who want to start playing immediately!

boardgame.name: Warpland
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Enter the Land of the Warp at your own risk! A dark world where technology and science are anathema and dark magick is just being discovered!

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter Online
怪物猎人 Online
boardgame.description:
It is the first Monster Hunter game to run on the CryEngine 3, allowing for highly detailed environments and dynamic lighting and weather effects. Created for the Chinese market, the game never released outside of China.

Monster Hunter Online has been discontinued as of 18th December, 2019.

boardgame.name: The Twisted Stave (Issue #1 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
The Twisted Stave

Issue #1

boardgame.name: The Royal Court
boardgame.description:
For centuries, rulers have ruled their Kingdoms with the support of a royal court. A royal comprised of the Kings closest and most trusted family, advisors and nobles. A Kingdom lived or died on the strength of their Kingdoms royal court.

In The Royal Court, players take on the role of royal advisors to their respective kingdoms. Each advisor has been tasked with gathering trusted individuals to join their own kingdom's court.

The Royal Court is played in a series of rounds. Over the course of a round, players fill their royal courts with trusted royals, clergy, servants, and of course the Kings and Queens themselves.

The object of The Royal Court is be the first player to win 3 rounds. To win a round, a player must assemble the highest scoring royal court.

Players take alternate turns drawing cards and performing actions. When the deck empty the round is over

To play a turn, players perform the following actions in order:

The first player draws the top 4 cards of the deck and forms 2 pairs of their choice face-up next to the draw pile.

The second player chooses which pair of cards they receive and which pair the other player receives.

Both players take and place their assigned pair of cards face-down in a single pile in front of them. This is their court. Now starting with the second player, repeat the above steps until the deck is empty.

When there are no more cards left to draw, each players score their own royal court for the current round. The player with the most points wins the round.

The first player to win 3 rounds is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:

How could an alien outbreak such as this spread so quickly? Is there something more sinister behind their sudden appearance? ... do your team know more than they say?

—description from the publisher

A choose-your own adventure style game.

boardgame.name: Pokémon TCG: V Battle Deck – Venusaur vs. Blastoise
boardgame.description:
Engage in a Pokémon Trading Card Game battle with the might of Pokémon V on your side in the V Battle Deck—Venusaur vs. Blastoise. This ready-to-play double deck bundle contains two full decks of 60 cards, one starring Venusaur V and one with Blastoise V. You and a friend can jump right into a match to see who will come out on top. This set also includes eight additional Trainer cards that can be used to bolster your deck. Not only that, but there are also useful accessories like playmats, damage counters, metallic coins, and deck boxes to enhance your experience. You can even improve your skills with guides to upgrading your deck and unlocking winning strategies, plus reference cards to make the game even easier to play. Choose your deck and prepare for battle!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chain Reaction: Cryptocurrency Trading
boardgame.description:
Players are cryptocurrency enthusiasts trading tokens and riding the highs and lows of the volatile crypto markets.
Starting with $5m and some fiat cards, players will take turns trading with the market, each other, and buying or playing value cards to affect the price of tokens.
Every round various valuers, market forces, regulators and hackers will cause the values of everything to fluctuate. This can make or break fortunes!
Will you become a billionaire crypto trader or hit the deck as a failed bit-nobody?

boardgame.name: Dungeon Degenerates: Hand of Doom – The Dirty Thirteen

13 New Cards for use with Dungeon Degenerates: Hand of Doom.

はぁって言うゲーム (”Ha-”tte Iu Ge-mu)
boardgame.description:
From the creator of video game classic Puyo Puyo comes a party game to test your acting abilities.

Use only facial expressions and the tone of your voice (and sometimes less than that) to portray different scenarios.

Does that “Ha-“ sound angry, heartbroken, or curious? Players draw a card that determines a topic sound like “Ha-“ or “Eh” along with a list of eight different scenarios. Individual players then draw a card that assigns them a scenario from the list to enact. Without using any body gestures, players act out their scenario to each other and try to guess who was assigned what.

boardgame.name: Rollway Station 2: Tracks of the Trade
boardgame.description:
Rollway Station 2 is a print and play train game inspired by the 18xx series of games. You take on the role of an investor in various train companies trying to make the most money over fifteen turns. You'll roll dice and assign them to three different actions as you invest in companies, auction off trains, and build track to develop your train network. In this sequel, you're also competing with a Rival who will buy shares and make investments to compete with your score. Can you earn more points than the Rival?

Each turn of Rollway Station 2, you roll 6 dice. You must then assign these dice to three different actions: buying a share in a company, laying track, and bidding on a train. The values of the dice determine the specific effect of each action, and you'll rarely get everything you want. After you've taken your turn, there will be one die left over which is used by the Rival, who will either compete with you for shares in valuable companies, or make their own investments in private companies. Every few rounds, all the trains run and you score points based on how good their routes are, but so does the Rival. No experience of Rollway Station is required to play and enjoy this game, it's totally standalone.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Split
boardgame.description:
You've managed to pull off the Heist of the Century. A fortune in gems, gold, paintings and more sit before you and your crew. The only question is how to divide the loot? The Boss suggests one final card game before you go your separate ways. It's time for... The Split.

Based on a modified version of the classic card game Blackjack, players will try to bluff and outwit each other to claim piles of loot cards. Collect cards and get your total value as close to 21 as possible - closest gets first pick of the stacks. Use your Bonus cards to manipulate your total, but don't play too safe... with one fewer stack on the table than there are players, you're never guaranteed a prize.

Each round sees one player act as the dealer, passing regular playing cards out to all players. Your initial aim is to score as close to 21 as possible without exceeding that number - special one-use Bonus cards can help you get closer to the target. Only players with the highest value scores can claim from the stacks of Loot Cards, containing different items such as gold, gems, valuable paintings and more. More loot is added each round, and the game continues until the Loot Deck is depleted. Each loot type scores in a different way, and the player with the most Loot at the end of the game will win. Play with the Disguise cards for a trickier version of the game, where you can't win without a way to escape!

With various difficulty modes, The Split offers an interactive, easy to learn experience that will appeal to a wide range of players. So, settle in, keep a straight face, and see how much you can walk away from the table with.

boardgame.name: The Festering Pit of Mokath
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Lured to Graven-Tosk by the promise of silver and sacrifice, you find the portal to your fortunes in one of the many plague pits. Descend into the depths on a doomed quest, the only certain outcome is total ruin!

Presented to you on a "Press-Ready" A4 page with 3mm bleed on all edges for professional printing! Fully illustrated and designed to kill all your friends!

boardgame.name: The Galgenbeck Lawyers
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A pen is mightier than the sword and they have both. The Galgenbeck Lawyers are primordial arbiters of the laws that stitch together the very fabric of the dying world's existence. Next to them you're just fine print. Cross them and they will cross you out.

boardgame.name: Go Goa
boardgame.description:
Are you eager to visit the tourist spots in Goa, the beautiful yet tiny state in India? So what will you choose? Do you wish to visit only the beaches or the forts? Or would you rather visit one of each type of destination? Or are you the one to complete your Tour Plans? Now you can enjoy the beauty of Goa in this Roll & Write game.

In Go Goa, you have 12 days to tour the state, collecting souvenirs from different tourist destinations. On each day, you select three dice to decide the direction, distance, and deviation in the route that you will travel and then trace a route to your new destination.

During each round, the Starting Player rolls 3 dice. The Starting Player reserves 1 Die for the direction that only they can use. All other players use the dice to determine the direction to travel in, the number of steps, and the deviations they are allowed to take. Players then draw the route that they are taking for the day on the player sheet. The player sheet represents the map of Goa. The map contains Tourist Destinations. If you end in a Tourist Destination you score points.

You also score bonus points for completing sets of five different destination types or three of one particular destination. In addition, you can also score points for completing the Tour Plans that you chose.
After all players take their turn, a new round is started and the player to the left of the current Starting Player is the new Starting Player.

The game ends after 12 days (rounds) are completed. At the of 12 days, players tally up their scores for the Tourist Destinations visited, and any bonus points that they may have collected along their trip. The player with the highest score wins.

ENTER THE COURT

Play as the world's top players, master each surface, perfect your game and strive to dominate the world circuit. Choose from multiple game modes, with singles and doubles games, local and online.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: U-Boat Captain: Solitaire WW2 Wargame
boardgame.description:
U-Boat Captain is a operational-tactical game covering individual German WW2 U-Boat combat. Comes with full rules (19 pages), 6"x 9" map, several U-Boat Displays, 27 counters, with optional rules, several scenarios and campaign games (of various lengths), extensive examples of play, and Designer's Notes.

Captain various historical German U-Boats (Type VIIB, VIIC, IXA, IXC) on North Atlantic patrols from 1939 through 1942 and try and achieve the most tonnage sunk you can, without being sunk yourself. Sail to your area of operation and conduct daily patrols/searches. If you have an encounter, decide when/if to attack (watch out for escorts). If you attack, perform the attack sequence and launch torpedoes, or use your deck gun. Can you be a successful U-Boat Captain?

Published in Panzerschreck magazine #19

In spite of being outnumbered 40 to 1, the Spaniards are the heavy favorite to win. But victory is not a foregone conclusion, and you’ll need to employ good strategy to emulate the historical result. Comes with 10 pages of rules, 6" x 9" map, 80 counters.

boardgame.name: Advent Crossroad
boardgame.description:
The local shopping center undergoes lockdown following a sudden appearance of monsters. A security guard and special agent are amongst the trapped guests. To find the exit—as well as answers—they must travel through distorted spaces and fight off strange creatures using the powers of mysterious devices known as "Tabernacles."
KEY FEATURES

Hybrid Navigation: Explore first-person mazes as well as top-down locations.

Fast-Paced Story: Experience a tension-filled atmosphere as characters find a way to escape.

Brisk Combat: Engage in challenging turn-based battles. Be on guard and exploit monsters' weaknesses to survive!

Customize Skillsets: Unlock new abilities during fights or the Skill Menu afterward.

boardgame.name: Paths to Aegis
boardgame.description:
Paths to Aegis is an automa rogue-lite deck-building board game. The game allows for 1-4 player cooperation as each player takes their own character with a unique set of abilities and strengths as they discover new tiles on their way to defeat Cerberus by gaining more powerful cards and leveling up.

Each turn the player rolls the die to move across the board or rolls the die if they're in battle. Rolling a 1 or a 2 places them in battle. Once a player is in battle, life clips keep track of health for both the player and each enemy they fight in battle.

While in battle, a player will use as many action cards as levels they are and use those actions to either damage the enemy or heal their health. On the enemy's turn to attack, the player must roll the die. Each enemy has a standard attack and most have a special attack. If the die roll matches the enemy's special attack, then it usually damages the player more than a standard attack. Once the enemy has been defeated, players earn coins which they can use to either purchase more action cards at the market or level up.

As it is a rogue-lite game, you can expect to die. But don't worry! Upon death, you only lose half your coins and you keep any cards you purchased.

boardgame.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Marvel Studios' Guardians of the Galaxy
boardgame.description:
In space, the rule of law is more of a loose guideline, so someone has to guard the galaxy. As your adventure unfolds, recruit the well-meaning but questionable methods of the Guardians of the Galaxy to fight by your side against galactic threats, like Ronan the Accuser! This new exciting Marvel Cinematic Universe Legendary expansion features characters from the first and second Guardians of the Galaxy movies. Ride across the Legendary cosmos with these mighty misfits in your hand.

This expansion includes 5 Heroes, 2 new Masterminds and Villain groups and requires a Marvel Legendary Core Set to play. This expansion is ideal to join the Marvel Studios Phase 1 Base Set.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Marvel Studios, Phase 1

listing.notes: Brand new in shrink.

boardgame.name: Roll 'n' GOL
boardgame.description:
Anything goes for your team to WIN!
What happens on the court is solved at the table.
Predict and change the results in your favor!
You don't need to know football to play.

A fun and dynamic game ideal for soccer lovers!

In Roll 'n' GOL you are going to simulate a soccer world cup, but living it from the table!

Each player will have a sheet where he will write down who, according to him, will win the World Cup, how the games will go, the number of goals and fouls, among other things.

The results of the matches will be given with dice rolls and each player will be able, at the cost of points, to use his special abilities to change the result of the matches.

Try to get your teams to the final! But don't forget to make life miserable for your rivals' teams!

At the end of the championship, the player who obtains the most points in his checkbook wins the game, correctly predicting the results of the matches. Points can be earned by using stars, inventing goals or penalties, or even having the game replayed.


Components:

block of sheets
2 Dice
1 schematic card
15 team cards
rulebook

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team
Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Octarius
boardgame.description:
While armies numbering millions clash on battlefields spread across a thousand worlds, specialised teams of elite operatives are dispatched on dangerous missions to accomplish vital objectives from the shadows. These kill teams, as they are known, are picked from the most capable and independent of their kind, using strange and esoteric skills to achieve what a mighty army could not.

The new edition of Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team has been redesigned from the ground up as the greatest tabletop skirmish experience yet, seeing teams of experienced operatives engage in vicious close-quarters combat as they race to complete their missions. In this book you'll find the complete rules for playing Kill Team as well as a host of missions to embark on, lore covering the grim darkness of the 41st Millennium, and insight on the factions vying for dominance among the shadows.

—description from the publisher

This boxed set includes:

1x 96-page Kill Team Octarius War Manual Book

23x Citadel Miniatures

17x Terrain Pieces

Double-sided Game Mat

Two decks of 27 Tactical Ops cards
