boardgame.name: Code Crackers
boardgame.description:
Code Crackers is a two-player card game that encourages players to utilize critical thinking, deductive reasoning, and code-cracking intuition to beat their opponent before getting their own codes cracked.

The beginning of the game moves quickly with players attempting to obtain the smallest inkling of what their opponent's code might be. Players will record their opponent's answers to their questions on their dry-erase Reference Cards. As the game progresses, gameplay becomes less about asking questions and more about deductive reasoning and critical thinking to crack your opponent's 3, 4, and 5-digit codes. The first player to crack the code wins.

Code Crackers is exhilarating for all ages (Given that they can add numbers between 0 and 10!)

boardgame.name: CARU UTA (狩歌)
boardgame.description:
With CARU UTA (狩歌) as long as a song contains Japanese lyrics, you can start playing a game of Karuta. A whole new way to appreciate your favorite tunes.

1) Spread the word cards onto a table or flat surface so that they are easily visible by all players.

2) Play a J-pop song of your choice. Or sing it yourself.  

3) Be the quickest player to claim a word card that matches the lyrics of the song.

Some word cards have a higher point value than others. Other cards and combinations will get you additional points.

After three songs have been played, the player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Tactics (Issue 27 - Feb 1986)
boardgame.description:
Tactics
Issue 27

February 1986

boardgame.name: Goblin Cave
boardgame.description:
Goblin Cave is an asymmetrical team-based tactics game featuring strategic, card-based combat driven by unique character abilities and player decisions.

Each player takes control of two unique characters, drawing cards with powerful abilities and moving freely around the board. Players will control tactical locations, place traps, launch fireballs, destroy walls, teleport across pits, climb ledges, sling arrows, swing great-axes, steal relics, and much, much more!

Each team of players has their own win conditions, and will go toe-to-toe with their opponents to achieve them through fast-paced strategy-fueled combat. Adventurers traverse the Goblins’ cave in order to steal Relics—objects of great arcane power. Goblins must defend their homes from the greedy invaders who are trying to steal their relics, navigating the cave through tunnels only they can use! Each team is comprised of unique characters with rich lore and powerful specialized abilities, not unlike a board game version of a MOBA (like League of Legends) or hero shooter (like Overwatch or Apex Legends).

Players control two characters simultaneously. On a player’s turn, they draw an ability card from each character's ability deck, roll a die for each character’s movement, then move and use an ability card for each character, in any order they wish. The game ends either when all characters on a team are incapacitated, when the Adventurers escape with a relic, or when 10 rounds have passed.

With 10 playable characters, multiple cave maps, and several planned expansions, Goblin Cave offers a great deal of replayability and long-term support.

boardgame.name: Do-Si Duel
boardgame.description:
High Noon: time to stand up and see which of you is the best in the West. Only one cowboy is walking away from this dust up so once you've got'em on the wrong end of a shootin' iron, you better keep'em there. Let loose with everything you've got to win, or play your ace in the hole to turn the tables. Either way you best be the last one standing if you want to win this Do-Si Duel!

Do-Si Duel recreates the feel of an Old West shootout across the kitchen table. Two players will alternate playing cards to claim actions. These actions move players around the table: players will simultaneously move one seat to the left or the right (always staying on opposite sides), switch places, or simply hold still. The player standing at the “Win” half of the table when either player runs out of cards is the winner. Complicating this are the various action costs. Each of the four actions has two available slots. The first player to claim that action spends one matching card to use the action and can reuse that action once later at the same cost. The second player must spend two matching cards for that action and can only use it once. Of course, spending more cards isn’t always a bad thing: once a player’s in position, they’ll want to get cards out of their hand quick to end the game! With hand management elements and a unique approach to real-space movement, Do-Si Duel packs a lot of wallop for players looking for a light strategy game.


Do-Si-Duel is a 2-player action drafting 18-card game for all ages that can fit in your pocket and be played in 5 minutes! What makes Do-Si-Duel unique? In Do-Si-Duel, you are the game piece. Each action will cause you and your opponent to move (or not move) around the table. The game is simple yet mentally menacing and lots of fun!

On each turn, players will play cards in the middle of the table on the available actions (left, right, hold, switch) and move accordingly around the table, trying to be on the Win side of the duel at the end of the game (when one of the players has no cards left in hand).
boardgame.boardgameversion: Button Shy English Print & Play edition
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Casino Felino
boardgame.description:
Join the cats in a fun casino night!

Casino Felino is a simple and light-hearted game of chance & wits, players become cats having a fun casino night. The cats take turns to participate in 7 minigames based on clasic casino games like poker (Miauker), blackjack (Black Cat), roulette (Siamese Roulette), etc. Each minigame is played once and it has its own set of very simple rules rolling up to 3 beautiful casino-themed dice. Players are awarded with points based on their performance, at the end of the game the player with most points win!


Black Cat: Each player throw two dice all times they want, trying to get up to 21 or as close as possible. If they surpass 21, they are out of the round. The players who are closest to 21 without surpassing it at the end, win 5 points.

boardgame.name: Steam Deck
boardgame.description: The Steam Deck is an upcoming handheld gaming computer developed by Valve Corporation

boardgame.name: Ghost Out (ゴーストアウト)
boardgame.description:
Ghost Out is an abstract game where players cast ghosts at each other. The first player to chase out all the ghosts from his or her area is the winner. On their turn, players chose whether to cast a ghost from either their own area or a shared area space. Ghosts can be casted in any diagonal direction.

When casting, a player will pick up all ghosts currently on that area space. The player then choses a direction and puts one ghost marker on each space proceeding straight in that direction until they have used up all the ghost markers.

If a player finishes casting and the last ghost marker lands in his or her own Safe Area, the player may take this single ghost marker and place it off the board to be used for Reincarnation.

After finishing this Capture step, the player may then choose whether to use Reincarnation or Store. By using Reincarnation, the player will draw a card with a bonus written on it. Reincarnation rewards the player with a bonus but if the player Stores their captured ghosts, they can trigger an even bigger Reincarnation bonus later in the game.

The bonus enables the player to cast again and chase away more ghosts from their area. However, players should be careful not to chase away too many ghosts which could result in limited choices. Instead, they should strategize to chain the bonus events together so that they can win in one fell swoop. At the end of a round, remove any ghosts that remain in either player’s Safe Area.

boardgame.name: Hrou dobrým motoristou
boardgame.description:
Czech board game about road traffic. The game was to teach children the rules of the road.

Each player has their own car on the game board - dice and tokens (money) are used to play, which are used to pay fines for violating the rules of the road.

Interesting fact:
The official rules of the game also provide a basic overview of road traffic signs.
The preface to the rules was written by the Ministry of Emergency Security

Basic course of the game:
It is played on a game board that shows the road (which has a clearly defined start and finish) and each player has his own figure (in the shape of a race car), which moves around the playing area. To move around the board, players roll the dice (three dice with numbers 1 to 6). At the beginning of the game, players roll the dice - the player with the highest total starts and then the others according to the sum on the dice.
Subsequently, the players take turns - everyone rolls the dice on their turn - and according to the sum on the dice, they move on the playing field towards the goal with the toy car.

The game board shows the roads, including traffic signs - for example:

Main road in front of the intersection - the player can continue without interruption
Side road in front of the intersection - you are on a side road and you have to pass all the vehicles on the main road - so deduct 2 points from your roll of the dice for the delay at the intersection.
Prohibition of overtaking - in corners or marked places, players may not overtake the vehicles of other players in front of them - they must follow them, even if they threw a larger number of points on the dice. It is possible to overtake only after the end of the overtaking ban.
Traffic light - the game contains a dice that has colors on the sides - red, yellow and green. When a player arrives at the intersection square with a traffic light, he must roll this dice and may not continue until he is green.
Speed ​​limit - a player who moves in this part of the road counts only half the value of his dice roll.
No stop sign - if a player ends his turn on this square, he must pay one coin fine.


The game also contains red wooden chips that represent money. At the beginning of the game, the players distribute them evenly. When playing, the places where fines are paid are defined - for example, No stop sign.

The winner is the player who reaches the finish line first and at the same time has at least one more money - so he did not spend everything on fines.

boardgame.name: The Doomed
boardgame.description:
A miniatures skirmish game, with simple rules, no measuring of distances, and an ethos of "playing to see what happens". Players bring their own miniatures, from any game range they like - or "kitbashed" from parts.

Game play is semi-competitive, with two player-controlled teams competing over the same scenario, with an automated "Horror" that threatens both teams.

Players alternate activating a character, with each character taking up to three actions. Actions (movement, attacks, saves) involve a six-sided die rolled and compared to a single "Quality" stat for that character.

boardgame.name: Order Pizza-la
boardgame.description:
Become a pizza chef and compete to collect pizza cards to complete your pizza. Each card has 1 of 6 kinds of ingredients and 1 of 8 kinds of alphabet keys.
In each round, the turn player flips a black card to reveal the alphabet key for that round, and all players get the card with that key at the same time.
At the end of the 8 rounds, you will have an 8-piece pizza.
You will score if you meet one of the two orders and complete the pizza with a particular type of piece. You win by getting the most points.

—user summary

listing.notes:
New in Factory Shrink
Stored in Temperature-controlled game storage room since acquisition Dedicated shelf space -- not stacked No smoking house, etc. and our games are handled and packed carefully
Discount shipping will be calculated based on actual location.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Agents of Chaos Dice Set
boardgame.description:
The skirmish battlefields of Warcry are a dangerous place, so what better way to channel the favour of the Dark Gods of Chaos than with a set of dice blessed by their omnipotence?

These 16mm six-sided dice are presented in a bespoke flip top box.

The dice set includes:

- 6x opaque red dice with white details
- 6x dice with an opaque black and white swirl (giving a grey and white look) with red details
- 4x opaque metallic red dice with a swirl and black details, which can be used as Wild Dice
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Sentinels of Order Dice Set
boardgame.description:
The skirmish battlefields of Warcry are a dangerous place, so what better way to channel the favour of the gods of Order than with a set of dice blessed by their omnipotence?

These 16mm six-sided dice are presented in a bespoke flip top box.

The dice set includes:

- 6x opaque matt blue dice with white details
- 6x opaque gold and white swirl effect dice with blue details
and
- 4x opaque white swirl effect dice with gold details, which can be used as Wild Dice
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Bringers of Death Dice Set
boardgame.description:
The skirmish battlefields of Warcry are a dangerous place, so what better way to channel the favour of the Nagash than with a set of dice blessed by his omnipotence?

These 16mm six-sided dice are presented in a bespoke flip top box.

The dice set includes:

- 6x opaque black dice with white details
- 6x opaque metallic silver dice with a swirl and black details
- 4x opaque metallic ghostly green dice with a swirl and black details, which can be used as Wild Dice
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set

boardgame.name: Mullewapp: Das große Wettrennen
boardgame.description:
An animal race for 2-4 players from 4 years. Pig Waldemar, Franz von Hahn and Johnny Mauser with sheep Wolke against farm dog Bello. Who will reach the farm first? Each animal has its own lane. In the cooperative variant, dice are rolled - for the animal dice, one of the animals is drawn one step accordingly, then for the symbol dice, an animal tile of the back is revealed and the animal is drawn, everyone remembers the animal to be able to draw a desired animal later. If all animals are at the finish line before Bello, everyone wins together. For the competitive variant, each player is assigned one of the four friends, and the first animal at the finish line wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Letters of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Letters of the Damned is a supplement for Quill that immerses the player in the dark fantasy world of MÖRK BORG. Take on the roles of the Damned Sovereign, Eldritch Scholar or the Dirge Poet, among others as you use your abilities and cunning to craft letters as part of a five scenario campaign. Attempt to create a ritual, taking care to choose the right ingredients; charm yourself into a cult to destroy its leader, use diplomacy to avert war in Blighthold and use dark alchemy to try resurrect a companion.

Letters of the Damned is designed to be played with the rules for Quill: A Letter-writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player rather than using the official MÖRK BORG rules. However, players of MÖRK BORG are encouraged to use Quill and Letters of the Damned as a type of mini-game in their own campaigns. You can also use the scenarios as hooks for an adventure on the tabletop. In Letters of the Damned you, the player, solve challenges through the written word. There are a couple of new rules that aren’t in the Quill rulebook included too. The book contains 5 scenarios set in the world of MÖRK BORG.

Note: this is not an adventure for Mork Borg. You will need the rules for Quill: A letter-writing roleplaying game for a single player in order to play.

Warning: This one ain't suitable for kids, folks. It contains gory imagery and violence.
boardgame.rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player

boardgame.name: I Stab At Thee!!! A Game of Last Words and Petty Vengeance
boardgame.description:
From the description:

I STAB AT THEE!!! is a sort-of-micro-role-playing-storytelling-improv-card-dexterity-party game (SOMRPSICDPG).

One player is the villain who is slowly and dramatically dying aboard their starship, which they have just set to self-destruct.

Another player is the dashing captain of the heroes’ ship. The other players portray the captain’s crew. They’ll need to repair their ship’s hyper-warp drive in time to escape the destruction of the villain’s ship.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED

Three or more players
A few index cards and something to write with
A standard deck of playing cards
A timer
A full-size replica of a starship for atmosphere

boardgame.name: Das Bachspiel
boardgame.description:
The Bachspiel is a fishing game with didactic information about the creatures in streams with high to low water quality. In the game, players use magnetic fishing hooks to fish for previously prepared animals or trash from cardboard boxes from behind a screen and receive points if they can match the animals to the correct water quality. No points are awarded for trash. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Institut für ökologische Forschung und Bildung e.V

boardgame.name: Adventure Master (Issue 1 - 1987)
boardgame.description: contains part 1 of the scenario "Das Monsterlabyrinth", the solo adventure "Der Weg durch die Mondberge", and a weapon (used in the scenario).

boardgame.name: Adventure Master (Issue 2 - 1987)
boardgame.description: contains the concluding part of the scenario "Das Monsterlabyrinth", new spells and weapons, and a short solo adventure.

boardgame.name: Чемпионы Мидгарда. Вальхалла и Тёмные горы
boardgame.description:
Two expansions in one box.

Champions of Midgard: Valhalla - The glorious dead gains the favors of the Valkyrie to help you win

Champions of Midgard: The Dark Mountains - Battle Bergrisars and recruit the Archer clansmen in the dark mountains
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Champions of Midgard: The Dark Mountains

boardgame.name: DAVIGO
boardgame.description: The VR player embodies a giant and faces off against one or more PC players in fast-paced, explosive combat!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: FortressCraft - Frozen Factory
boardgame.description: Cartoon
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Soviet Kitchen Unleashed
boardgame.description: Soviet Kitchen Unleashed is a cooperative card game about blending the weirdest ingredients in a meat grinder to match the perfect color!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Hitchhiker - A Mystery Game
boardgame.description: Hitchhiker is a mystery game set along lost highways, where your goal is to solve the puzzle of your own backstory.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Long Feature Award Nominee

boardgame.name: A Rogue Escape
boardgame.description: A Rogue Escape is an imaginative blend of escape room discovery, storytelling, and all the interactive elements you could ask for.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Long Feature Award Nominee

boardgame.name: Stilstand
boardgame.description: Stilstand is an interactive graphic novel by comic artist Ida Hartmann and game studio Niila Games.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Most Amazing Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Worlock
boardgame.description: Crypt of the Worlock is an homage to the microgames of the 70s and 80s in which one or more players take on the role of a wizard, warrior, dwarf, healer, and thief to raid a litch's lair.

boardgame.name: Wolfpack
boardgame.description:
Kill (collect) as many sheep and strange wolves as possible. And don't always just be nice - this is how you get to victory faster.

Cards are drawn one after the other from the flock of sheep. As soon as the action cards are used, the game gets really exciting.

The game ends. when all strange wolves are eliminated or there are no more sheep on the table that can be picked up.



Reisse (sammle) so viele Schafe und fremde Wölfe wie möglich. Und dabei nicht immer nur nett sein - so kommt man schneller zum Sieg. Es wird der Reihe nach Karten aus der Schafherde gezogen. Sobald die Actionkarten eingesetzt werden, bekommt das Spiel so richtig Spannung. Zudem ist das Spiel hochwertig verpackt und erstklassig designt. Empfohlen ab 10 Jahren empfohlen und für 2 - 5 Spieler.

boardgame.name: Wer versteckt sich hier... im Dschungel?
boardgame.description: Players should find one of the 8 animals on an animal card on a jungle map with 11 animals. Whoever finds the animal gets to keep the animal card, and the next animal card and jungle card are revealed. Whoever collects the most animal cards wins the game. There are 3 other very similar game suggestions in the game rules.

boardgame.name: The Orb of Goodbyes
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Orb of Goodbyes is a magical item blessed with the power to extract and erase memories from a willing creature's mind.

When a Waterdeep lieutenant retires from military service, she seeks the Orb to forget a dangerous memory.

Those who help procure the Orb from an enchanted cave discover the secrets behind this magical artifact and unearth its hidden memories.

The adventurers may then decide whether to deliver the Orb and help the veteran find peace, or use the item themselves to release burdens from their past.

boardgame.name: 5D Chess With Multiverse Time Travel
boardgame.description:
It's the first ever chess variant with spatial, temporal, and parallel dimensions. It's 5D Chess With Multiverse Time Travel ! Move pieces back in time to create branching timelines. Send a rook to a parallel dimension. Protect your kings in the present and in the past!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Publicity
boardgame.description: Rush through town and try to do the shopping as soon as possible. But be careful, there are other people out and about in the city and they try to slow you down. Use your cards cleverly and hinder your fellow players. Get to the finish line first.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Tips & Tricks: Monthly (Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Tips and Tricks: Monthly is a magazine containing a collection of ideas and concepts from the Crit Academy podcast. A D&D talk show designed to provide guidance and inspiration to both players and DMs. With the exception of the monsters, many of the ideas and concepts are system agnostic and can benefit players and DMs in many other systems and settings.

What you get:

Character Concept: We offer character ideas that can help bring your character to life. Whether you need a full character idea or use them as inspiration to enhance your already great character.

Monsters: We can often find that some of our favorite monsters get a little predictable, or we want a little more variation in our selection. We provide new monsters that can keep your characters on their toes, as well as load them up with flavor and lore to be discovered by the loremaster in your group.

Encounters: Here we offer a collection of short scenarios that can be used as a jumping-off point for a full adventure, a one-shot, or dropped into an existing campaign. It's chock-full of unique ideas and scenarios that we hope will spark your creative side, ensuring your players have an experience they will never forget.

Magic Items: Here we share custom magical items that you can drop into your game. Drop them into a chest, or have an enemy wield them against your characters.

Game Master Tips: Being a GM is tough work. Sometimes we could use a little bit of help. Much like a bag of holding, this section is packed to the brim with tips we've learned over the years to help you deliver the best gaming experience possible.

Player Tip: Oftentimes, we as players can take for granted the massive amount of work that the GM puts into the game. In the end, we don’t spend much time thinking about what we can bring to the table. The golden rule every player knows is "Don't be a D*ck!" In this section, we give you tips on how you can avoid doing just that, as well as tips on leveling up your gameplay. Both roleplay, and mechanical.

Two One-Page Adventures: I'm a huge fan of short and sweet. Each issue contains two one-page adventures written by best-selling adventure writers. This ensures you get fun, unique, and engaging adventures to last you through the night.

Adventure Map: Inside you will find a custom map, rich with setting descriptions to spark your imagination. Each copy comes with a link for the digital high-quality map for your hands, or Virtual Table Top experience.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #4)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this fourth issue:

Explor the Daggerwood, a Novice Zone for Infinity's Edge!
The Ninja and Blood Mage Specialist Classes for Infinity's Edge!
Explore the Near Planes in Thunderscape TinyD6!
Discover the inner workings of the Radiant Order for Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Hero Building 101, explore the versatility of Summoning for Tiny Legacies!
In Random Heroes for Tiny Legacies, we meet Infernal!

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #5)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this fifth issue:

Expanded Beast-Bond rules for Infinity's Edge!
An exploration of the Three Kingdoms, a new setting for Infinity's Edge!
A new ferran heritage, the Ferran Flyer, for Thunderscape TinyD6!
A new organization and Trait for Thunderscape TinyD6!
A series of unused legacies from the Iron Age for Tiny Legacies!
In Random Heroes, we meet the Weird, enigmatic defender of Austin, for Tiny Legacies!

boardgame.name: Roll Camera!: The B-Movie Expansion
Камера! Мотор! Кінотреш
boardgame.description:
Congrats, filmmaker!

Your career is finally finding its footing, thanks to your determination, luck, and more than a few questionable scripts. While other filmmakers burden themselves with “important” movies that have “big” budgets and are “good,” YOU are wisely blazing a trail in the opposite direction: the B-Movie! Yes, the B-movie - low on budget, but high on thrills, chills, and bloody spills. This may not be the glamorous side of Hollywood but if you roll your dice right, it could still be profitable!

This time around, you'll have access to new roles and specialized equipment to help you get the job done. But your responsibility to produce a watchable film is as demanding as ever! Your movies now have unique genre requirements: crime, fantasy, horror, sci-fi, western -- or some kind of mixed-up genre soup combination. The whole thing is causing more disorganization and chaos than ever before...

There's even less time to waste - Roll Camera!!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Roll Camera!: The Filmmaking Board Game

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Back to BasiX (Issues 1-10)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The initial print run of ten issues, gathered into one US Trade hardcover size for B/X enthusiasts! The 216-page book features a new color cover by the fanzine's original cover artist, Matthew Ray.

Back to BasiX was a quarterly fanzine focused on the B/X version of the world's most popular tabletop role-playing game. It was created and printed between June, 2017 and September, 2019, and was available in PDF and print. The individual PDFs are still accessible at DriveThruRPG.com, but print issues are becoming harder to find.

Across a ten-issue print run, it offers reviews of B/X products new and old; interviews with legendary authors and artists; and all-original content for the game.

boardgame.name: Horrible Henchmen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Several months ago, a mysterious stranger moved to the outskirts of the quiet and peaceful town of Summerford, and terrible misfortune has plagued the townsfolk ever since that fateful day.

Unbeknownst to the hapless citizens, the enigmatic interloper is actually an evil villain with dastardly plans for the town and its people. Robbery, kidnapping, and cold-blooded murder are all in a day’s work for this newcomer, with each crime playing a vital role in their master plan—their magnum opus.

You are the villain’s horrible henchmen, skulking in the shadows as you serve your master’s will and help bring their nefarious plans to fruition. The master gives your life meaning, and you live to obey!”

Horrible Henchmen is a standalone scenario for the Tricube Tales system and is usable as a micro-setting, but it is also a fully self-contained one-page RPG in its own right. You can print it on a single sheet of paper: The first page includes everything you need to play, while an optional second page expands the adventure generator with examples and twists. The PDF uses layers for ease of printing.

boardgame.name: Sabre Second Edition Fantasy: Legends
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout ancient history, there are those who overcame monumental challenges, faced unspeakable foes and went on to become true legends in their field. In this manual, you'll find the equipment and abilities to allow your players to walk the same path. There are talents to increase the capability of your magical and martial prowess, unique magic items of unequalled power, and monsters to challenge even the mightiest of heroes to give your Sabre RPG campaign that truly legendary finale your players crave, nay, deserve!

The relics and legends provided within aren't campaign world specific, so they're suitable for any setting you wish to use them in.

boardgame.name: Neo-Tokyo 2100: A Future Shock Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the mercenaries arrive in Neo-Tokyo 2100, they are greeted by a country determined to cling to tradition and ignore the growing urban blight. Shadowy work is available everywhere in Japan's sprawling metropolis. The team can interact with a wide range of fixers and connections, ranging from the Triad's Three Toes Chao and the retired Yakuza boss, Matsuo "Boss" Shige, to Genji Corporation's co-CEOs, the mysterious brothers Yoritomo and Yoshitsune Genji.

WHAT'S INSIDE
Neo-Tokyo is a fast-hitting Savage Worlds adventure book including:

Over six major connections, each with their own subplots and story arcs
A major adventure storyline with three acts and an explosive finale
Nearly twenty distinct locations, each with plot hooks and story elements
Twelve side quests ranging from drunk sumo wrestlers to murderous cyber-psychos
Details on Genji Corporation's experimental cloning technology

boardgame.name: Integrated Arsenals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Gun Show!

Get new options for your Starfinder explorers of to combine meat and machine into cyber-organic firepower! Unleash the Integrated Arsenal soldier fighting style and Cyber-Organics feat with 10 terrific new gear boosts like divergent bionics, aftermarket integration, retractable rend, and laser bash!

boardgame.name: Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Christmas themed one shot adventure module designed for a festive night of fun with friends and family that is compatible with Pathfinder 1E.

As the quiet snowflakes of midwinter drifted down, an icy despair overtook the village of Hopesburg. Night by night, the village's children were disappearing. The only clue to their fate were tiny footprints that disappeared into the deep dark snow covered Feldspar forest.

"Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop" is the story of a deranged gnome who was denied the joys of Christmas as a child. As a mad adult, he has become maniacally obsessed by the trappings of Yuletide. Over many frenzied sleepless months, he has converted his secret workshop into a Christmas horror land that is just as twisted as he is. In the gnome's cracked mind, all that remains now is to fill the workshop with children to enjoy its Christmas wonders, whether they like it or not.

Murderous gingerbread men, demanding snowmen, zombie carolers, violent nutcracker automatons, and more will challenge your players at every turn, as they try to save or destroy Christmas for the children of Hopesburg.

This module is suggested for groups from level 3 to level 5. Feel free though to make the monsters/skill checks easier or more difficult to custom tailor play for characters of any level. We believe in the design philosophy that the module is a suggested story, which the DM can take as is, or change in any way they see fit. You are the captain of this adventure.

Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop is designed to be played with only a few minutes of preparation. Key points, skill checks, items, and decisions; stand out in bold text so you can quickly find what you need. Skill check successes and failures are clearly set in boxes to make it easy and fast to find the text/results you need. No more fishing through paragraphs of text to try and find key points. But don't just take our word for it, see some of our page examples for yourself.

boardgame.name: Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Christmas themed one shot adventure module designed for a festive night of fun with friends and family that is compatible with 5E DnD.

As the quiet snowflakes of midwinter drifted down, an icy despair overtook the village of Hopesburg. Night by night, the village's children were disappearing. The only clue to their fate were tiny footprints that disappeared into the deep dark snow covered Feldspar forest.

"Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop" is the story of a deranged gnome who was denied the joys of Christmas as a child. As a mad adult, he has become maniacally obsessed by the trappings of Yuletide. Over many frenzied sleepless months, he has converted his secret workshop into a Christmas horror land that is just as twisted as he is. In the gnome's cracked mind, all that remains now is to fill the workshop with children to enjoy its Christmas wonders, whether they like it or not.

Murderous gingerbread men, demanding snowmen, zombie carolers, violent nutcracker automatons, and more will challenge your players at every turn, as they try to save or destroy Christmas for the children of Hopesburg.

This module is suggested for groups from level 3 to level 5. Feel free though to make the monsters/skill checks easier or more difficult to custom tailor play for characters of any level. We believe in the design philosophy that the module is a suggested story, which the DM can take as is, or change in any way they see fit. You are the captain of this adventure.

Pilgrim's Christmas Workshop is designed to be played with only a few minutes of preparation. Key points, skill checks, items, and decisions; stand out in bold text so you can quickly find what you need. Skill check successes and failures are clearly set in boxes to make it easy and fast to find the text/results you need. No more fishing through paragraphs of text to try and find key points. But don't just take our word for it, see some of our page examples for yourself.

boardgame.name: Rifleman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The rifleman ranger is a "minor magecraft" class, which interacts with the magecraft features of the Magus class. These classes are designed to be setting-appropriate to the material the Magus is used for, while allowing players to utilize other classes and not be tied down to a full spellcaster. More will be made available!

A fighter who has learned to temper their practical skills with magecraft, the rifleman is a gunner who increases their speed, precision and efficiency. The world of mages looks down upon those who use firearms, so the rifleman accepts that their place in either world will be defined by their utility, usually as an assassin or bodyguard.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Drafter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon Drafter is the perfect tool for creating and tracking the exciting details of all your adventures!

Fight game master burnout with this finely tuned adventure design workbook! Nothing kills a campaign faster than a DM struggling to create unique and meaningful games for their players over and over and over.. You need every tool you can find to help fight the War against Time and Drudgery, fight back with a tool that can really help! Dungeon Drafter!

Not a mere page after page of blank graphs or lines, we designed this journal around how we actually write and play adventures ourselves. We've been running and playing tabletop roleplaying games for over 40 years and have used that experience to help design this adventure composition book to read and flow in ways that work during play sessions. With a mix of guided prompts to start things off, and plenty of mixed journal pages including open dotted, lined, graphed and just enough custom ones to help kick things along.

Start off by blocking out your story quickly using the unique Story Block page. Refined from a union of many of the best systems used by professional writers and adventure designers, the Story Block gives you a super quick way to add drama and meaning to your games.

Then add meat to the bones of your epic quests with a layout structured to match those of popular published adventures, complete with prompts for adventure hooks, room description blocks, npc portraits and bios, and more. Finish it all up with help from customized Randomizer tables, and sign your name on the spine to live forever in infamy as the most prepared game master of all!

150+ Pages
Each workbook contains:

Instructions on Story Structure
Story Randomizer tables
Blank Random Tables for customizing
Fillable Contents page, with easy reference side tabs
6 large Adventure Chapters, each with the following:.
The Story Block, to help create truly engaging & exciting adventures
Guided Prompts for breaking down the main who, what, why and what's in it for your players
Concept & character Gallery pages
Story Hooks & Key Character tracking pages
Graph paper Map Sheets, with ready-to-use room & area description blocks
Bullet and dot-lined journal pages for notes and details
Dive into quickly creating fantastic adventures with Dungeon Drafter!

boardgame.name: The Road to Monsterberg Chapter 2: Secret of the Golden Hills
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cut your way across war torn medieval Europe!

Welcome to the 15th Century! The year is 1456 and you are now in the middle of the Duchy of Silesia: Three hundred miles of castles, fortified towns, and deep, spooky forests, drained by the waters of the mighty Oder river, and flanked by forboding mountains. This land of mystery and intrigue is a melting pot of three great cultures: German, Polish, and Czech, and the region is known both for the strife between its many feuding lords, and the great wealth of its many mines. It could be a land of riches, but this "rich land" is notorious for the robber knights, feuding city-states, desperate bandits, and bloodthirsty foriegn raiders who threaten commerce, prosperity, and life itself.

The Duke of Opole is one of the few princes in the region with a genuine interest in restoring order and harmony. He needs to get to the bottom of many threatening mysteries, but doesn't know who is friend and who is foe. You and your compatriots arrived from another land, and have won the trust of the Duke. Now he wants you to investigate a perilous mystery in the southern reaches of his realm.

In the heavily forested foothills of the Sudetes mountanins, along the troubled border with the Duke's most powerful neighbor, the heretic kingdom of Bohemia, a string of robberies, kidnappings and disappearances, threaten the land with war. There are rumors of fantastic riches, as well as legends of eldritch mountain spirits... The whole region is a powder keg, and the Duke needs investigators to get to the bottom of the trouble before it gets out of hand. Are you intrepid enough, brave enough, and tough enough to learn the secrets of the Golden Hills?

The road to Monsterberg, Chapter 2 is a historically based adventure module, designed for use with the Codex Martialis historical combat system. It is the second of a three chapter series, but can be played as a stand-alone adventure. It comes with historical maps of the region, towns and castles, as well as detailed descriptions of towns, markets with equipment and prices, standardized and specific NPCs and both random and planned encounters. It is intended for 4-7 characters of levels 4-6, made for a low-magic, historical setting, with elements of occult horror thrown into the mix.

This is an immersive, fast paced, dynamic adventure, which your characters can really sink their teeth into. As tension and fear build, the Codex rules allow them to apply their most devious fighting tricks and strategies to defeat perilous enemies from the history books, and from the legends right out of the fairy tales of centuries past. If you are looking for a world that feels real enough to be dangerous, but is still remote enough for great adventures, The Road to Monsterberg is your gateway to a historical reality which is stranger than fiction.

This module is made for OGL, and is essentially version agnostic but is easily adaptable Pathfinder, to 5e or to various OSR systems. It is designed to be Low Magic and mid-to low-level play, but is highly customizable, so that GMs and players can make it their own. Take a step to a realm just adjacent to the fantasy genres you know so well, but is full of surprising twists and turns that are fresh and interesting fodder for gripping gameplay.

boardgame.name: The Lonely Coast (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
The furthest flung outpost of a mighty kingdom, turbulent waters and forbidding, trackless forests separate the folk of the Lonely Coast from civilisation’s gaudy lights and soft pleasures. Pirates and slavers ply the southern storm-tossed waters while goblins and other foul things creep through the gloom of the Tangled Wood that seemingly chokes the forgotten holds and sacred places of the Old People. Deep within the forest, a narrow, rock-choked defile piled deep with shadow cuts through a nameless range of rugged, tree-shrouded hills birthing dark, fearsome legends of terrifying monsters and glittering, doom-laden treasures. The perils of the Lonely Coast are legion and thus there is always a need for those with stout hearts and skill with blade and spell, or for those merely hungry for glory, to defend humanity’s most tenuous enclave.

This 90-page sourcebook presents full details of the Lonely Coast along with its four villages (Bossin, Hosford, Oakhurst and Swallowfeld) along with the vibrant, frontier town of Wolverton.

boardgame.name: The Winter Maiden of Yveren's Overlook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Among the sprawling mountains and highland flats of Dracia, warriors young and old fear the kiss of the Winter Maiden. Although not considered a malevolent being, this fae creature enjoys challenging the strong and inflicting torment upon the weak, reveling in their inner conflict and turmoil through a formidable trial. And for those who rise above, she grants the victor the fabled ‘kiss’, bestowing them the favor of the Winter Lord.

The Winter Maiden of Yveren’s Overlook is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for one and up players with 10th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Goetia: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Goetia the Card Game is a quick, easy to play game for 2-4 players where the aim of the game is to be victorious in pitting the Ars Goetia Demons against one another in a battle of wills as well as brawn.

Will you be able to strategically thrust your Demons into the fray at the most opportune moment when they're at their most powerful? Or risk summoning them early when they're weaker in case you lose control of them and are forced to use them? And will you have the Seals at hand to make sure your Demons are boosted, or enable you to banish your opponent's Demons that threaten your victory? Luck will certainly play a big part when largely uncontrollable entities are involved, but Demonic victory will depend on how well you play the hand you're dealt.

On a turn each player will play cards & also metal tokens (seals).
It's played over 3-6 rounds (depending on number of players).
The player with the highest points score at the end of the rounds wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wiedergängers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A troop of battle-hardened World War II soldiers ordered to hold a French chateau are terrorized by unseen forces!

boardgame.name: Celawyn's Guide to Wilderness and Fey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Between the city and the dungeon is the wilderness, but what do you do there? Fight a single random encounter, no matter how far the journey, heal up immediately afterwards, and then move on? There’s no need for the wilderness to be so one-note! With Celawyn’s Guide to Wilderness and Fey, you’ll find revised rules for food, rest, encounters, and encumbrance that turn the wilderness into a challenge of their own, focusing less on beancounting pound for pound and more on the hard decisions of how much food versus potions you’re going to pack and what you’re going to do if your donkey dies to a random encounter and your carrying capacity gets cut in half.

Or set out to hunt a monster down with the new rules for monster hunting, tracking down your quarry using paw or clawprints, roars or howls, and other clues in a fully simulated ecosystem that is nevertheless quick and easy to run.

Embrace the beast within and play as the mighty werewolf, another of the series’ transformations that consume magic item slots in exchange for powerful lycanthropic abilities compatible with any race and class combination, or embrace every beast within with the new Shapeshifter class, dedicated entirely to transforming into lions, tigers, and bears.

Lean on the mischievous magic of the fey to play as the new pixie race. Or maybe your magic is more cruel and vengeful than playful pranks, and you want to play as a nightmarish hag! Or another sort of hag, for that matter. Come together with two other hags, of any type, and you can form a powerful coven.

boardgame.name: Castle Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With this simple generator you will be able to create memorable castles on the fly.

Whether during wilderness exploration or domain play, your players will inevitably encounter castles and its attached domain. Now you will be able to manage your players visiting or besieging them more easily.

This supplement contains:

A table of content
A castle name generator (720 possibilities)
Numerous tables to generate every aspects of a castle:
Structure
Keep
Defense (walls, towers, garrisson, ...)
Domain & Relation
Treasure

boardgame.name: Dice Drop
boardgame.description:
Awards & Recognitions:
2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

11th Best easy build
12th Best game by a new solo designer
13th Best game designed within the contest timeframe
14th Best low ink printing


Strategically drop the dice into the 6x7 grid and make shapes to gain points in this free arcade-inspired 1-sheet print-and-play game by first-time designer, Clint Ghosn.

How to Play
1. Take dice from the dice bag and roll.
2. Place the dice on their corresponding columns while using power-ups to mitigate your roll.
3. Drop all dice in the grid and score any shapes you matched

Do this for 3 rounds of increasing difficulty aimed to emulate fast-paced arcade gameplay.

boardgame.name: Dark Metal: Mercenaries in the Deep
boardgame.description:
A Sci-Fi Adventure RPG featuring Tabletop Tactical Combat and Solo Play set in the Walking Steel universe

From the introduction:

Dark Metal is a solo or cooperative open miniatures sci fi adventure tabletop tactics game about a group of mercenaries stuck in a star system isolated from the rest of the settled galaxy. The game is primarily narrative driven through a series of campaign books as you fight your way through your problems while trying not to annoy the Captain. No GM is required to enjoy the game.

User summary:

Dark Metal: Mercenaries in the Deep is a lightly adapted miniatures game (see Dark Metal) allowing the addition of roleplaying and narrative arcs suitable for solitaire play.
boardgame.rpg: Dark Metal: Mercenaries in the Deep

boardgame.name: Peabody, Peacock Merchant
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Peabody waits in the dungeon for customers with a few avian goods.

boardgame.name: Britain's Battle of the Bulge: Elsenborn Ridge
boardgame.description:
Soon after the 16 December 1944 German attack in the Ardennes, British troops began moving into position for a counter-attack. By late December the British XXX Corps was heavily involved in helping push back the German Sixth Panzer Army, advancing alongside the Americans to erase all German gains by early January.

The Battle of the Bulge is rightly celebrated as an American victory; most troops involved were Americans, and most casualties likewise were Americans. But the British Army fought as well, and we celebrate their victories over fascism as well.

Requires Elsenborn Ridge and Liberation 1944 to play all of the scenarios.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Elsenborn Ridge: Tactical Combat During the Battle of the Bulge – A Panzer Grenadier Game
Liberation 1944: The British Campaign in North West Europe – A Panzer Grenadier Game

boardgame.name: 2 Nun 2 Run (fan expansion for Nuns on the Run)
boardgame.description:
A revamp on the beloved classic from 2010, 2 Nun 2 Run adds a new map and extra goal cards to this hidden movement chase game.

Up to 6 novices must sneak through an all-new abbey, to find their heart's desire. The novices must remain watchful for the Abbess or Prioress, who are on patrol to ensure no mischief is wrought.

In 2020, Frederic Moyersoen uploaded files for the unpublished expansion to Nuns on the Run, canceled when Mayfair Games shut down in 2018. That prototype has now been developed into this print and play expansion.

You will also need from the original game from 2010:
Rule Book, Log Sheets, Novice Tokens, Guard figures, Noise and Vanished Tokens, Captured and Turn Markers, Line of Sight edge, Novice Status and Movement Cards and Guard Movement cards and Blessing Cards.

boardgame.name: Nersha
boardgame.description:
Nersha — A unique and customizable game of abstract strategy. Relive an ancient tale and lead your people home before they’re lost to the blizzard. 12 maps are included, with millions more to discover.

The goal is to lead 3 of your pieces home before your rival. Players take turns sliding 1 of their pieces across the board. There are no captures or jumps, but players' pieces will keep sliding on open tiles if they move in a direction until they would run into something. When you lead a piece home, that's one less piece on the board to block your rival. Every piece on the board may help or halt your progress.

While Nersha has several board layouts that ship with the game, players can decide to change the board or the number of pieces to play with, among other aspects. There are also seven different tile types that can add more complexity to mapmaking.

This game is designed to bridge between casual or abstract games you learn as a kid with daunting games like chess, bringing together all playstyles.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Nersha: Capstones
Nersha: Playmat

boardgame.name: The Rocketeer: Fate of the Future
boardgame.description:
Trouble is brewing high above the city of angels! The mysterious Rocketeer — who can blast through the skies with an ingenious jet-pack — must stop a sinister plot. Hollywood actor Neville Sinclair is scheming to steal the rocket's blueprints as this breakthrough of modern engineering could revolutionize the future of flight. But in Sinclair's hands, it could also fuel the dark future of warfare.

In the two-player game The Rocketeer: Fate of the Future, you play as either the heroes or the villains. On your turn, pick one of your characters and take an action with them, optionally playing cards from your hand that match that character's symbol. Card actions are: Move, Tussle (combat), Gain Grit, Raise Rocket Token (heroes), Recruit a Soldier (villain). Players alternate turns until all six characters (three on each side) have taken actions and are exhausted, then players gain rewards based on control of the locations and prepare for a new round.

The end of the game happens when the Luxembourg Zeppelin reaches LA, after which you play the final round, then the game ends.

boardgame.name: Space Pirate's Treasure
boardgame.description:
Each player controls a pirate ship flying around an asteroid belt trying to find the loot of a long dead pirate captain.

Ideal for multiplayer club games or introducing new people to wargaming, simple to learn and hopefully fun to play.

Turn Sequence:

Randomly determine the order of play for the turn
Each player activates their ship in turn
Move dust clouds
Roll for random events
Roll for end of game


–Description from the publsiher

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Heton Sector
boardgame.description:
September 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

You will be taking The Final Lightyear to the Heton Sector where the Spaceport J77 is located. In this sector the Market makes an appearance, so now's your chance to load up on some Burster Bombs. Lurking in this sector is both the Scarab Mother and a Terradact Fighter, so beware!!


Released in the September 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Food Chain Island: Legendary Creatures
boardgame.description:
Get ready, we're headed back to Food Chain Island! You will be meeting Legendary Creatures! What makes these legendary creatures so legendary? Well, for one they're mythical creatures! On the island you'll see a Phoenix for the first time. These creatures stay hidden and can not be eaten until they are face up. Also, a legendary animal has its power activated when it is eaten.

The legendary animals are unique in two ways:


First, they start hidden. A legendary animal cannot be eaten until it is face-up. When an animal is eaten orthogonally adjacent to a legendary animal, then it is flipped face-up. It can then be eaten.



Second, a legendary animal has its power activated when it is eaten. It does not have a special ability that activates when it eats. The animal that eats the legendary animal will also have its effect active, and you must fulfill both effects.


In addition, some of the numbers included in this expansion already exist in the base game. Animals of the same number cannot eat one another, unless they have an ability that allows them to do so.

boardgame.name: Five Parsecs From Home: Trailblazer's Toolkit
boardgame.description:
You are knee-deep in radioactive dust on some colony-world nobody has ever heard of, there are Precursor marines sniping at you whenever you stick your head up and the nano-comms are completely scrambled.

The Trailblazer’s Toolkit is here to help you out!

The first expansion for the RPG-Lite adventure wargame Five Parsecs From Home 3rd edition gives you 58 pages packed full of new options to customize your game and the way you play.

Players get an introductory 4 turn campaign perfect for getting a soft start on the game or introducing a friend, more narrative content with random tables will generate the names of starships, planets, colonies and corporate patrons, two different systems for progressively increasing the difficulty of the campaign as you play, a unique scenario and set-up sequence for player vs player battles and a co-op scenario.

We’ve also dialed up the adversaries, AI variations add unpredictability and a wider array of possible actions to each type of enemy.

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Parsecs From Home: Solo Adventure Wargaming

boardgame.name: Temporal Odyssey 2
boardgame.description:
A battle card game about dueling Time Travelers! This is a stand-alone sequel to the original Temporal Odyssey.

Draft cards from the Past, Present, and future decks and enlist epic characters to banish the other Traveler from the timeline! Each time period has its own theme and mechanics, and each class has specific uses and value depending on the situation and your Traveler's needs. Each card you draft provides elemental power. Collecting certain elements will level up your Traveler's spells, enabling power plays that can shift the pace of a fight dramatically. Each Traveler uses each element differently, and can greatly affect how you prioritize your drafting and banning.

Banishing enemy characters, securing artifacts, and defeating rival Travelers will destabilize your opponent's timeline, but also grant them more power. Once their stability is lost, defeat their Traveler one final time to win!

The game ends when you defeat the enemy Traveler after they have 3+ instability cards.

boardgame.name: GIRI game
boardgame.description:
GIRI Game is a storytelling card game for children that develops communications skills, imagination and emotional intelligence. GIRI Game helps children improve their attention span. Some kids have shorter attention spans because of too much 'screen time'. Through playing GIRI card game and telling stories with set elements, children improve their focus, learn to express their thoughts and ideas fully, and improvise in the moment.

There are two roles in the game:
The Storyteller, team or player who tells the story.
The Teaser, team or player that distract the Storyteller by inserting their oen card into the course of the story.

Each Teaser team/Player draws one card from the Teaser Category. The drawn cards are not shown to the Storyteller.
Storyteller starts to tell a story, based on cards from categories: Characters, Objects, Theme, Place, Atmosphere.

As the Storyteller tells a story, the Teaser team tries to distract the Storyteller or change the way the story is told.
Each Teaser team shall do this once, whenever they want to during the story. The Storyteller has to stay focused on his story... And include Teaser cards in it.

The winner is the one who scores the most points in all rounds of the game. The maximum possible score in each round is 12. A maximum of 6 points is obtained for technical difficulty of the story and a maximum of 6 points for artistic impression.

boardgame.name: Schweizer Reise
boardgame.description:
You can feel the ice-cold wind on your face. Snow is crunching under your feet. The panorama is simply amazing. You are standing on Jungfraujoch and looking out over Switzerland – it is a feeling like no other! You quickly take a picture before continuing on with your tour of Switzerland. There is so much to discover. In Broc you want to see Maison Cailler, the famous Swiss chocolaterie, and you plan to visit the Olympic Museum in Lausanne. And perhaps you will be lucky enough to snap a picture of an ibex in the national park! But unfortunately your holidays will soon be over. Only those who plan well manage to see as much of Switzerland as they can before the holidays officially come to an end. You obviously also need a bit of luck on this kind of trip. An exciting game for all Switzerland enthusiasts.

Aim of the game
You are exploring Switzerland with a small group of travellers. Your three travellers start in different cities in Switzerland: one starts in German-speaking Switzerland (in Basel), one starts in Ticino (in Mendrisio) and one starts in Western Switzerland (in Geneva). You win the game if you score the most points with your three travellers. To earn points, your travellers have to reach as many destinations as possible, go on discovery tours and take pictures of attractions.

How to play
The youngest player is the tour guide and is responsible for managing the calendar during the game. The youngest player begins the game and takes a turn. A turn means they 1) roll the dice and reroll and 2) perform the roll results. After a turn, the next player takes their turn going anticlockwise, and so on. Every time the tour guide takes their turn, a new day of travel begins. The tour guide moves the calendar marker forward to the next day.

boardgame.name: GUATAFAMILY 'the family edition of Guatafac'
boardgame.description:
The game of imagination and mental agility to laugh with your family :)

Answer in less than 8 seconds to questions of all kinds: family, school, moments, laughs ...

Win points by answering correctly to each card. The one who answers more questions corrrectly and has more points at the end of the game wins :)

A game to play from 8 years to 99, adapted to the family. Play in 15 to 60 min, 3 to 10 players and millions of possible answers.
Cards printed in the European Union on paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities.

boardgame.name: Mobile Markets: A Smartphone Inc. Game
boardgame.description:
Congratulations! You are the CEO of a multinational consumer electronics company ready for the new mobile technologies generation. Compete with other smartphone manufacturers for selling as many goods as possible by planning technology researches, marketing campaigns, production and sales for the whole year. Gain advantages while resolving your plans for victory!

Mobile Markets is a new stand-alone game in the line of Smartphone Inc. providing a similar game experience as the Smartphone Inc. (2018). But it offers players new mechanics, more complexity and strategic planning, interaction, and competition.

Join the race to satisfy the various demands of different types of customers all around the world!
