in shrink
Title: Mobile Markets: A Smartphone Inc. Game Publisher: Cosmodrome Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: TV Master
boardgame.description: The players move their game pieces via a spiral into the center of media power by rolling the dice. Opposing figures can be hit and reset. On some fields, questions about Austrian TV shows have to be answered. Points are awarded for correctly answered questions, depending on how far you are from the goal. The game ends when a player has reached the goal or all question cards have been distributed. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Sword & Sails: Mercenaries & Privateers
boardgame.description:
Mercenaries & Privateers is a card expansion for the Epic Board game, Swords & Sails: Rewrite History in 1000 AD.

The new expansion will Feature 100 new cards, including the Mercenary/Privateer, Revolt and Calamity/Prosperity categories of intrigue cards. This will expanded the original deck of 60 intrigue cards and the 4 original categories of Development (Green), Political (Blue), Espionage (Yellow), and War (Red) to 6 Categories adding the Calamity (Grey) and the Prosperity (White) categories. The new Mercenary and Privateer cards are in the War (Red) category. Intrigue cards expand the options which Swords & Sails players have during a game and represent many simulated choices which make the game more realistic and very satisfying to play. Intrigue cards are acquired by players during the intrigue phase of the game, with each player gaining at least one card, each turn.

For more details on the original game Swords & Sails, rules, and components, please see the Rules section below.

boardgame.name: Balla Balla
boardgame.description:
Players place their white beads on a floating surface of colored balls, which eventually yield to the pressure of the beads. The player who is not careful must take all the fallen pearls. The first player to run out of pearls wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jamboree Game
boardgame.description:
The Jamboree Game is a roll and move game that sees players move around a winding track with 130 spots.

The board shows a course where players are scouts that trek around the outdoors passing along the way wild animals, a ration dump and Indian camp. Players roll a dice and move the number of spaces indicated by the dice throw. Along the way certain numbered spaces require the player to follow directions written next to the spot. Some will help the player while other spots incur a penalty. First player to reach the last space (130) is declared the winner and ends the game.

boardgame.name: Schmetterling
boardgame.description:
The players roll a color die and place their stones on same-colored parts of 9 butterflies. Whoever has placed 3 stones on a butterfly takes possession of it. A foreign stone may be exchanged for one of your own stones if you are already represented on the butterfly. Butterflies on which three players are represented are removed from the game. The game ends when only one butterfly is left in the game. The winner is the player who has been able to take possession of the most butterflies.

—user summary

boardgame.name: BattleCON: Andrus Dochartaigh Royal Bodyguard
boardgame.description:
Andrus fights with two swords, each of which gains a special kind of charge that can boost his attacks. These recharge over time, so Andrus must choose when to exert each burst of power for maximum effect.

Draw your blades and strike out to overwhelm your rivals’ defenses!

boardgame.name: BattleCON: Rheye Cal Celestial Sojourner
boardgame.description:
Rheye’s talismans act as traps, locking up portions of the board or forcing her opponents to activate their game-changing effects. Though these traps are limited, just a few of them can turn the tide of a battle.

Intimidate opponents as you strike from afar, wielding divine, binding magic to smite your foes!

boardgame.name: Off the Books
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

“You read enough stories and it starts to make you wonder... what am I doing stuck in this one?” - Lady Calathea

A magical mishap occurs when a handful of freshmen enchantment students cast a modified version of the awaken spell on a fantasy epic in the university library, and now characters are leaping off the page - literally! As heroes, villains, and damsels come to life, the librarians need someone to restore narrative order to the unruly tales. But as the lines between fiction and reality blur, some of the characters begin to suspect their stories are cages they'd rather not return to at all.

A level 5 one-shot adventure for three to six players.

boardgame.name: Ravenloft: Overkill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A DM's guide to preparing for a truly excessive and immersive Curse of Strahd, Expedition to Castle Ravenloft, or indeed any gothic-horror adventuring campaign, in Pathfinder or 5E/Fifth Edition

I've waited more than 30 years to run a Ravenloft camapign, and in 2021, I got my chance.

9 players. Many in different states. All playing via VTT.

How, then, to attract and keep their attention? How to use in-game artifacts to satisfy real-life curiosity? How to make Barovia seem, feel, and function fundamentally differently from how even the ultra-experienced players in the group might expect?

How do I terrify the PLAYERS, and not merely the CHARACTERS?

Some have called my approach to running Curse of Strahd "insane", "crazy", or "unhinged".

Me? I call it Overkill.

Contained in this over-the-top guide to DMs preparing for a Curse of Strahd campaign are the following:

Written for Pathfinder and with rules language included for 5E/Fifth Edition, the tools are easily adaptable into any fantasy / gothic horror fantasy tabletop RPG rules system.
New rules, including the Knowledge (Ravenloft) skill, Sanity Checks, and Insanity
A complete multi-page checklist guiding your preparation for the ultimate Curse of Strahd campaign
60 letters and handouts, each intended to invoke atmosphere, extend characterization, describe lore, subvert the party, and/or drive the PCs to action
76 magic items: coins, pendants, vials, and necklaces, intended as in-game artifacts that will delight and surprise even the most jaded and experienced of players
Multiple treasure tables to drive discovery of the new custom magic items
Rules for a complete overhaul of the economy of Barovia
Snippets that extend existing COS content such as making the processing of ghostly adventurers even more terrifying
An Excel file that catalogs everything in the document, including suggestions for background music taken from the Castlevania video games.
A PowerPoint file that catalogs each and every new magic item with visuals, intended for both players and DMs to reference.
Individual PDFs for each and every one of the 60 letters, ready to print and use in your game.
Microsoft Word files for Letter and A4 format versions of the 60+ letters, so you can easily adapt them to your own campaign.

boardgame.name: Bloody Mary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The only way to stop most bleeding is to apply pressure. In Mary's case, it was the opposite. During a violent attack, Mary found she could unleash powers that let her control other people's blood. With that attacker down, woe to anyone else pressuring her ever again!

Written by Dominique Sumner, with full color art by Joe Singleton, and layout by Walt Robillard. Each volume of Hostile Intent presents an extensively detailed character, or villainous organization, that can be seamlessly integrated into Villains and Vigilantes roleplaying game; from a one-shot adventure to an ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Sonne, Mond + Sterne
boardgame.description: Players draw celestial bodies from a small bag and collect them in front of them. Whoever draws a green celestial body may exchange a celestial body with a fellow player. The green one goes back into the bag. The goal is to collect celestial bodies of the same color. The first player to collect 6 pieces wins the game.

boardgame.name: Spears & Spells Fantasy Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spears & Spells is a streamlined tabletop roleplaying game designed to get you telling fantastic stories with your friends in no time. It's easy to play, easy to run, and suitable for any fantasy setting, from heroic to gritty. It's designed with the OSR (Old School Revival) in mind, evoking traits of the classic RPGs we grew up with.


Heroic Yet Simple

We wanted a game that was fast, simple, and transparent. Spears & Spells is designed to help the characters be heroes without needing a half-dozen rulebooks containing hundreds of pages of confusing rules. The math is balanced to be slightly in the characters’ favor, though it’s still pretty easy for them to die if they’re not careful.


Every Die is a d6

From initial stat generation to damage dice, nothing in Spears & Spells uses any die but a d6. Having a half dozen d6s handy is a good idea.


Tasks

To determine outcomes players roll dice based on their character stats. These rolls are called Tasks. The Ref works together with the player to determine which stat governs the Task, though the Ref makes the final decision. You roll some six-sided dice, hoping the total is under that stat. If it is, you succeed!


Customized Characters

Spears & Spells is classless, and it uses levels. Characters choose Talents at creation and level-up. How you choose Talents lets you custom-tailor your character so they can do precisely what you want them to do.


Fail-Forward

Spears & Spells uses "fail-forward" techniques when a Task roll doesn't come up a success. Rather than failure stopping the game in its tracks, it complicates matters and makes the session more interesting!

boardgame.name: Lost Throne of Talukeld the Broken (Spears & Spells)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Talukeld the Broken was a leader of a great horde of warriors who swept in from the West, conquering the Known World. It is said that his throne, made from the bones of his enemies, has manifested numerous magical powers.

The Kingdom of Kriqatha is threatened. An army of giants with invasion in mind is massing on Kriqatha’s borders. The adventurers have been called to the palace of King Goscelinus, where they are tasked with questing for the Lost Throne.

With the throne in the King’s possession, nothing can stand before his army. His knights will sweep all his foes into the sea — but only if the adventurers can bring back the throne in time.

Talukeld’s Tomb is located deep in a fiery mountain two weeks from the King’s palace. It looms high above the blasted landscape of the Broken Lands.

If the adventurers have no transport, the King gives them horses, a cart, and the consumable supplies they’ll need for the journey to the tomb and back again. He also promises them 1,000 splonders each, along with the right to keep any treasure they find in the tomb (save for the throne itself).

The King gives the adventurers an ancient, crude map showing the way to Talukeld’s Tomb. No one has been there in generations, so nobody knows what dangers might be encountered along the journey, nor what they might find in the tomb once they arrive. The map has a curious symbol in one corner: a clenched fist holding a short, broad-bladed spear...

boardgame.name: Lost Throne of Talukeld the Broken (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Talukeld the Broken was a leader of a great horde of warriors who swept in from the West, conquering the Known World. It is said that his throne, made from the bones of his enemies, has manifested numerous magical powers.

The Kingdom of Kriqatha is threatened. An army of giants with invasion in mind is massing on Kriqatha’s borders. The adventurers have been called to the palace of King Goscelinus, where they are tasked with questing for the Lost Throne.

With the throne in the King’s possession, nothing can stand before his army. His knights will sweep all his foes into the sea — but only if the adventurers can bring back the throne in time.

Talukeld’s Tomb is located deep in a fiery mountain two weeks from the King’s palace. It looms high above the blasted landscape of the Broken Lands.

If the adventurers have no transport, the King gives them horses, a cart, and the consumable supplies they’ll need for the journey to the tomb and back again. He also promises them 1,000 splonders each, along with the right to keep any treasure they find in the tomb (save for the throne itself).

The King gives the adventurers an ancient, crude map showing the way to Talukeld’s Tomb. No one has been there in generations, so nobody knows what dangers might be encountered along the journey, nor what they might find in the tomb once they arrive. The map has a curious symbol in one corner: a clenched fist holding a short, broad-bladed spear...

boardgame.name: Shade Wave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The shade wave rogue is a "minor magecraft" class, which interacts with the magecraft features of the Magus class. These classes are designed to be setting-appropriate to the material the Magus is used for, while allowing players to utilize other classes and not be tied down to a full spellcaster. More will be made available!

A talent for staring into the darkness and seeing potential can arise within lesser mages who are aligned with it. This knowledge of how shadows function conceptually, and this second-hand awareness of the innate power that resides within one's own shadow, can be manifested as skills that reshape the shadow into tools by projecting a change within their perception of the self.

These skills, though born in shadow, are not seen as evil or untoward. Shade wave magecraft is a form of self-perception magecraft that treats the shadow as a temperable reflection of the self, and a tool that can be utilized in many situations.

boardgame.name: Warlock! Wondrous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for Warlock!, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming.

Wondrous things!

The Kingdom is a place of magic strange and rare, and the history books are full of wondrous items from distant, more enlightened times. Finding these precious things is a goal of any wizard - undoubtedly these things bring power. But beware, there’s alway a price to pay...

Wondrous is a collection of magical items that may be found in the treasure hoards and forgotten ruins of the Kingdom, or any fantasy realm for that matter. Storied items, these magical treasures cast a light on the past of the Kingdom, for those that care to learn.

boardgame.name: Sounds on a Space Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space stations are not quiet places. These are working environments with the sound no where to go. Any sound made within is going to be heard by more than intended. Make that station come to life to your players with d66 Sounds on a Space Station.
14 Buzz of the ultraviolet air scrubbers
33 High-pitched buzzing of a sonic toolset
51 Popping sound of an overworked grav plate

boardgame.name: Smells on a Space Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With no where for a smell to go, space stations can really stink. The smell of burned wires can linger longer than body odor, especially if the air scrubbers have not been cleaned recently. Make the space station come alive by describing it to their olfactory sense. Download d66 Smells on a Space Station.
16 Chemical "fresh" scent
32 Grilled sythmeat
66 Wet furry alien

boardgame.name: Human Pilot Names With Call Signs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why identify a pilot as John Smith when you can give them a memorable call sign? Give your NPCs some personality as well as a name with this list. Download d66 Human Pilot Names with Call Signs now.
16 Bo "Bull" Horn
31 Helena "Caller" Kahler
62 Tatenda "Hawk" Okafor

boardgame.name: Skytear Horde
boardgame.description:
Skytear Horde is a solo and cooperative card game inspired by tower defense video games. Waves of monsters will siege your castle all the while a sea of minions will pillage all your resources. Choose a legendary hero to rally the troops, defend the walls, and defeat the Outsider. Now go and fight, for the alliance!

The core gameplay of Skytear Horde is the combat between waves of monsters and your hero and troops defending the castle. If you played card battlers like Heartstone or KeyForge, you will find yourself at home.

You lose if your castle is destroyed or if your deck runs out of cards. On the other hand, to win it will not be enough to “just survive” the horde. You will have to find the resources to leave the castle and tear down the gates that are spawning the waves of monsters.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

New PREORDER KS collectors pledge
KS delays are common

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Taylor & Gus Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
Trusted members of the Kingdom’s security, Taylor and Gus often ride on patrols beyond the walls of their safe home to keep borders secure and trade routes with other scattered settlements open.

Contents:

1x Resin Taylor Model
1x Resin Gus Model
11 All Out War Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 7 Equipment Cards, 2 Veteran Skill Cards
8 Call to Arms Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 6 Equipment Cards

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Guard Booster Pack
boardgame.description: Kingdom guards ride to war better equipped than most other survivors. With swords and firearms at their disposal and swift horses to outrun walkers, they make formidable opponents.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Faction Pack

boardgame.name: Magic Maze: New Wooden Pawns
boardgame.description:
Brand new wooden pawns for Magic Maze! (2021)
4 Colorful pawns, stamped in the shape of your favorite characters
and 1 new BIG red “Do Something!” pawn.

(These pawns are also available in Magic Maze from the print MM/21/2021/05).
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Magic Maze

boardgame.name: BattleCON: Victor Master of Terror
boardgame.description:
Victor’s suggestions help him to control opponents, threatening dangerous disadvantages if they violate his commands. The opponent can only afford to break so many suggestions during a fight, so look for ways to force their hand or put them in an awkward position.

Terrorize opponents with your suggestions, or punish those foolish enough to defy them!

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Eurohell 3D Upgrade Trees
boardgame.description:
Don’t just take a forest tile, plant a small forest next to your game board with our 3D Upgrade Trees.

16 x 1s tree
8 x 5s tree
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Eurohell Markers
boardgame.description:
Rockets for the counting bar, an O2 bottle and a thermometer bring you a special highlight on the table. Let yourself be enchanted and enjoy the special atmosphere while counting points or adjusting global parameters.

1 x Rocket per player color
1 x O2 Cylinder
1 x Thermometer
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Eurohell Overlay
boardgame.description:
Overlays in 4 colors to choose from:

turquoise
red-brown
black
slightly translucent in semi-transparent


The highlight is that you have 1-4 places per field, so that especially at the beginning of the track bar, two players can safely stand on the same field.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition

boardgame.name: The Movie Movie Game
boardgame.description: In Movie Movie Game, you and your friends test your knowledge of popular movie titles in the stupidest way possible. Movie Movie Game forces its players to bend and twist their brains in ways hitherto unseen by modern humankind. Anyone can name a movie based on a loose outline of its plot, but Movie Movie Game combines titles in such a way that you'll be dying laughing as your friend struggles to find the right way to say "Saving Private RyAnnihilation." Pro-tip: The trick is to really let them squirm...
